intro: Maesa denticulata, commonly known as the toothed maesa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
